tit.e: Town's name of the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City
Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City
Town names in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City
tit.cmt: 「山科区」というトピックが別に存在するため、区別するために「町名」を明記する表現に戻しました。Yamashina-ku Ward→Yamashina Ward

sen.j: 本項京都市山科区の町名（きょうとしやましなくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section, the Town's name of the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, shows the list of the official town's names in the Yamashina Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section on Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, shows a list of official town names in Yamashina Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section on "Town Names in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City", lists official "Town Names" in Yamashina Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Yamashina-ku Ward→Yamashina Ward

tit.e: The summary of the Yamashina Ward
Summary of Yamashina Ward
Summary of Yamashina Ward
tit.cmt: 区名の表記を変えました。Yamashina-ku Ward→Yamashina Ward

sen.j: 京都市中心部から東山 (京都府)を越えた東、滋賀県との県境に位置する。
sen.e: It is located in the east of Mt.Higashi (Kyoto Prefecture), which is in the east end of the central Kyoto, and the west of the Shiga Prefecture.
It is located on the east side of Mt.Higashi (Kyoto Prefecture), at the east end of central Kyoto, and west of Shiga Prefecture.
Yamashina Ward is located on the east side of Higashiyama Ward (Kyoto Prefecture), on the prefecture's border with Shiga.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Yamashina-ku Ward→Yamashina WardHigashiyama-ku Ward→Higashiyama Ward

sen.j: 東は滋賀県大津市、北・西・南は京都市左京区、東山区、伏見区に接する。
sen.e: The Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, is located in the east, the Sakyo Ward, Kyoto city, in the north, the Higashiyama Ward in the west, and the Fushimi Ward in the south.
Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, is located in the east, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto city, in the north, Higashiyama Ward in the west, and Fushimi Ward in the south.
Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, is located in the east, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, is in the north, west, and south, Higashiyama Ward is in the west, and Fushimi Ward is in the south.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Sakyo-ku Ward→Sakyo WardHigashiyama-ku Ward→Higashiyama WardFushimi-ku Ward→Fushimi Ward

sen.j: 面積28.78平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It is 28.78 square km in area.
It covers an area of 28.78 square kms.
It covers an area of 28.78 square kilometers.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞき表記を変えました。

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約136,000人。
sen.e: Its population is estimated about 136,000 as of March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 136,000 as of March 2009.
Its population projection is about 136,000 as of March 2009.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: かつては東山区の一部であったが、昭和51年（1976年）に同区から分区した。
sen.e: It was once a part of the Higashiyama Ward, but separated from it in 1976.
It was once a part of Higashiyama Ward, but became separate in 1976.
It was once part of Higashiyama Ward, but split off from the ward in 1976.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Higashiyama-ku Ward→Higashiyama Ward

sen.j: 区域は、周囲を如意ヶ岳、音羽山、醍醐山、東山などの山々に囲まれた盆地である。
sen.e: It is a basin surrounded by mountains such as Mt. Nyoigadake, Mt.Otowa, Mt.Daigo and Mt, Higashi.
It is a basin surrounded by mountains such as Mt. Nyoigadake, Mt.Otowa, Mt.Daigo, and Mt, Higashi.
It is a basin surrounded by mountains including Mt. Nyoigadake, Mt. Otowa, Mt. Daigo, and Mt. Higashi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 区の北寄りを旧東海道が東西に走り、奈良方面への奈良街道も通じるなど、古くから交通の要衝であった。
sen.e: There is the former Tokai-do Road in the northern part of the Yamashina Ward as well as Nara-kaido Road which leads to Nara City, and it has been a key junction of traffic since ancient times.
There is the former Tokai-do Road in the northern part of Yamashina Ward as well as the Nara-kaido Road that leads to Nara City, and it has been a key traffic junction since ancient times.
With the ancient Tokai-do Road running in the northern part of Yamashina Ward as well as the Nara-kaido Road leading to Nara City, the ward has been a major traffic center since olden times.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Yamashina-ku Ward→Yamashina Ward

sen.j: 現在もJR東海道本線、東海道・山陽新幹線、国道1号、名神高速道路が区内を通っている。
sen.e: At present, there are JR Tokaido Main Line, Tokaido and Sanyo Shinkansen line, National Route 1 and Meishin Expressway in the ward.
At present, there are the JR Tokaido Main Line, Tokaido, and Sanyo Shinkansen line, National Route 1, and the Meishin Expressway in the ward.
At present, there are the JR Tokaido Main Line, Tokaido, and Sanyo Shinkansen (bullet train) line, National Route 1, and the Meishin Expressway in the ward.

sen.j: 区内にはいわゆる観光スポットは少ないが、北部には天智天皇山科陵、毘沙門堂門跡、安祥寺 (京都市)、本圀寺（日蓮宗大本山）などがあり、区南端近くにはともに真言宗本山寺院である勧修寺、随心院がある。
sen.e: There are few sightseeing spots in the ward except the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji, the Bishamon-do Monzeki Temple, the Ansho-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and the Honkoku-ji Temple (the grand head temple of the Nichiren sect) in the northern area and the Kaju-ji Temple and the Zuishin-in Temple, which are the head temples of the Shingon sect, in the southern area.
sen.cmt: 「勧修寺」は、地名では「かんしゅうじ」ですが、寺の名前は「かじゅうじ」です。
sen.e: There are few sightseeing spots in the ward except for the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji, the Bishamon-do Monzeki Temple, the Ansho-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and the Honkoku-ji Temple (the grand head temple of the Nichiren sect) in the northern area and the Kaju-ji Temple and the Zuishin-in Temple, which are the head temples of the Shingon sect, in the southern area.

There are few sightseeing spots in the ward except for: the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji, the Bishamon-do Monzeki (monzeki is the temple formerly led by founder of sect, temple in which resided a member of nobility or imperial family), the Ansho-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and the Honkoku-ji Temple (the grand head temple of the Nichiren sect) in the northern area; and the Kaju-ji Temple and the Zuishin-in Temple, which are the head temples of the Shingon sect, in the southern area.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）の市制町村制施行時、この地は宇治郡山科村であった。
sen.e: When the Municipal Government Act became effective in 1889, this area was named as the Yamashina village, Uji County.
When the Municipal Government Act became effective in 1889, this area was named Yamashina village, Uji County.
When the Municipal Government Act became effective in 1889, this area was named Yamashina-mura village, Uji County.
sen.cmt: 補足しました。Uji-gun County→Uji County

sen.j: 同村は大正15年（1926年）に町制を施行して山科町となるが、5年後の昭和6年（1931年）には京都市東山区に編入された。
sen.e: This village was changed to the Yamashina Town in 1926, and integrated into the Higashiyama Ward five years later, in 1931.
This village was changed to Yamashina Town in 1926, and was integrated into Higashiyama Ward five years later, in 1931.
This village gained town status to become Yamashinacho Town in 1926, and was integrated into Higashiyama Ward five years later, in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Higashiyama-ku Ward→Higashiyama Ward

sen.j: その後、前述のとおり昭和51年（1976年）に同区から分区して山科区となっている。
sen.e: After that, it was separated from the Higashiyama Ward in 1976 as the Yamashina Ward as mentioned above.
After that, it was separated from Higashiyama Ward in 1976 as Yamashina Ward (mentioned above).
After that, as mentioned above, it split off from Higashiyama Ward in 1976 to form Yamashina Ward.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Higashiyama-ku Ward→Higashiyama Ward-ku削除

tit.e: The summary of the towns
Summary of the towns
Summary of Town Names
tit.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

tit.e: The number of the town's name
Number of the town names
Number of Town Names
tit.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: The town's names in the Kyoto City are categorized into the one which uses the former village name or former Oaza (larger section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara') and the one which uses an independent name of town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-chi.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The town names in Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (larger section of a village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara') and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-chi.'

The Town Names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-Cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-Cho' and 'Kikuya-Cho'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 山科区内の町名は例外なく、旧大字名を冠した複合町名である。
sen.e: The town's names in the Yamashina Ward all includes the former Oaza with no exceptions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The town names in Yamashina Ward all include the former Oaza without exception.
The town names in Yamashina Ward all include the former Oaza.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。-ku削除

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在302町であった。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of the place-name of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture," there were officially three-hundred and two towns in 1980.
According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture," there were officially three-hundred and two towns in 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 302 declared towns in 1980.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、土地区画整理事業に伴う町界の変更、一部新町名の設置等はあるが、上述の302町は2009年現在も存続している。
sen.e: After that, although the borders of some towns were changed and some new towns were created in accordance with the land readjustment project, the above three-hundred and two towns have still exist in 2009.

After that, although the borders of some towns were changed and some new towns were created in accordance with the land readjustment project, the above three-hundred and two towns still exist in 2009.
After that, although the borders of some towns were changed and some new towns were created in accordance with the land readjustment project, the above-mentioned 302 towns still exist in 2009.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: なお、昭和59年（1984年）に3町、平成6年に1町が新設されているため、2009年現在の町数は306町である。
sen.e: In addition, since the three towns were newly created in 1984 and the one town in 1994, there are three-hundred and six towns in 2009.
In addition, since three towns were newly created in 1984 and one town in 1994, there are three-hundred and six towns in 2009.
Since three towns were newly created in 1984 and one town was created in 1994, there are three-hundred and six towns in 2009.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

tit.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）の市制町村制施行から、山科区成立までの沿革は既に述べたとおりである。
sen.e: The history from the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889 to the establishment of the Yamashina Ward is mentioned above.
The history from the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889 to the establishment of Yamashina Ward is mentioned above.
The history since the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889 until the establishment of Yamashina Ward is mentioned above.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。-ku削除

sen.j: 宇治郡山科町には安朱、上野、大塚、大宅（おおやけ）、音羽、小野、上花山（かみかざん）、川田、勧修寺、北花山（きたかざん）、栗栖野、小山、四ノ宮（しのみや）、厨子奥、竹鼻、椥辻（なぎつじ）、西野、西野山、八軒、東野、髭茶屋、日ノ岡、御陵（みささぎ）の23の大字が存在したが、これらは昭和6年（1931年）、山科町が当時の東山区に編入した際に計301町に編成された。
sen.e: In the Yamashina Town, Uji County, there were twenty-three Oaza of Anshu, Ueno, Otsuka, Oyake, Otowa, Ono, Kami-kazan, Kawata, Kanshuji, Kita-kazan, Kurisuno, Koyama, Shinomiya, Zushioku, Takehana, Nagitsuji, Nishino, Nishinoyama, Hachiken, Higashino, Higechaya, Hinooka, and Misasagi, which were reorganized into three-hundred and one towns in 1931 when the Yamashina Town was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward.

In the Yamashina Town, Uji County, there were twenty-three Oaza of Anshu, Ueno, Otsuka, Oyake, Otowa, Ono, Kami-kazan, Kawata, Kanshuji, Kita-kazan, Kurisuno, Koyama, Shinomiya, Zushioku, Takehana, Nagitsuji, Nishino, Nishinoyama, Hachiken, Higashino, Higechaya, Hinooka, and Misasagi, which were reorganized into three-hundred and one towns in 1931 when the Yamashina Town was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward.

In Yamashina-cho Town, Uji County: there were twenty-three Oaza (Anshu, Ueno, Otsuka, Oyake, Otowa, Ono, Kami-kazan, Kawata, Kanshuji, Kita-kazan, Kurisuno, Koyama, Shinomiya, Zushioku, Takehana, Nagitsuji, Nishino, Nishinoyama, Hachiken, Higashino, Higechaya, Hino-oka, and Misasagi) which were reorganized into three-hundred and one towns in 1931 when Yamashina-cho Town was integrated into Higashiyama Ward.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。-ku削除Uji-gun County→Uji County

sen.j: これらの町は、「山科」の後に旧大字名を付したものを冠称し、たとえば「東山区山科安朱稲荷山町」のように称していたが、昭和51年（1976年）の山科区分区後は、「山科」の冠称を廃している。
sen.e: For these town's names, the former Oaza had been used on the head after the name of 'Yamashina,' such as 'Yamashina Anshu Inariyama-cho, Higashiyama Ward,' but the name of 'Yamashina' was not used after the separation of the Yamashina Ward in 1976.

For these town names, the former Oaza had been used after the name of 'Yamashina,' such as 'Yamashina Anshu Inariyama-cho, Higashiyama Ward,' but the name of 'Yamashina' was not used after the separation of Yamashina Ward in 1976.

For these town names, the former Oaza had been used after the name of 'Yamashina,' such as 'Yamashina Anshu Inuyama-Cho, Higashiyamaku Ward,' but the name of 'Yamashina' was not used after the separation of Yamashinaku Ward in 1976.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: （明治22年 - 大正15年）宇治郡山科村大字安朱字稲荷山
sen.e: (1889-1926) Aza (section of village) Inariyama, Oaza Anshu, Yamashina village, Uji County
(1889-1926) Aza (section of village) Inariyama, Oaza Anshu, Yamashina village, Uji County
(1889-1926) Aza Inariyama, Oaza Anshu, Yamashinamura village, Uji County ('Aza' is a section of village).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Ujigun County→Uji County

sen.j: （大正15年 - 昭和6年）宇治郡山科町大字安朱字稲荷山
sen.e: (1926-1931) Aza (section of village) Inariyama, Oaza Anshu, Yamashina Town, Uji County
(1926-1931) Aza (section of village) Inariyama, Oaza Anshu, Yamashina Town, Uji County

sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Ujigun County→Uji County

sen.j: （昭和6年 - 51年）京都市東山区山科安朱稲荷山町
sen.e: (1931-1976) Yamashina Anshu Inariyama-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City
(1931-1976) Yamashina Anshu Inariyama-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City
(1931-1976) Yamashina Anshu Inariyama-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: （昭和51年以降）京都市山科区安朱稲荷山町
sen.e: (After 1976) Anshu Inariyama-cho, Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City
(After 1976) Anshu Inariyama-cho, Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City
(After 1976) Anshu Inariyama-cho, Yamashinaku Ward, Kyoto City
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 「安朱東谷」「大塚大岩」のように、末尾に「町」字を付さない町名が一部に存在する。
sen.e: There are some towns which have no letters of 'cho' (which means town) in the end such as 'Anshu Higashidani' and 'Otsuka Oiwa.'
There are some towns that have no letters of 'cho' (meaning town) on the end such as 'Anshu Higashidani' and 'Otsuka Oiwa.'
There are some towns that have no letter of '町' (read as 'cho', meaning town) on the end such as 'Anshu Higashidani' and 'Otsuka Oiwa.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: これらは、山間部などで、昭和6年の町名成立時において当該区域内に人家が存在しなかったものである。
sen.e: These are the towns in the mountain area where no one lived when the Yamashina town was established in 1931..
These are the towns in the mountain areas where no one lived when Yamashina town was established in 1931..
These are the towns in the mountain areas where no one was living when Yamashinacho Town was established in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 「安朱」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字安朱で、昭和6年（1931年）、当時の東山区へ編入された際、17町に編成された。
sen.e: The towns which include the name 'Anshu' on the head are the former Oaza Anshu, Yamashina Town, which were reorganized into the seventeen towns when it was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
The towns that include the name 'Anshu' were the former Oaza Anshu, Yamashina Town, that was reorganized into seventeen towns when it was integrated into Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Town that includes the name 'Anshu' is the former Oaza Anshu, Yamashinacho Town, that was reorganized into seventeen towns when it was integrated into Higashiyamaku Ward in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 「上野」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字上野で、昭和6年、当時の東山区へ編入された際、4町に編成された。
sen.e: The towns which include the name 'Ueno' on the head are the former Oaza Ueno, Yamashina Town, which were reorganized into the four towns when it was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Towns that include the name 'Ueno' were the former Oaza Ueno, Yamashina Town, that was reorganized into four towns when it was integrated into Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Town that includes the name 'Ueno' is the former Oaza Ueno, Yamashinacho Town, that was reorganized into four towns when it was integrated into Higashiyamaku Ward in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: これら4町はJR山科駅周辺の3か所に分かれて存在する。
sen.e: These four towns are separated into the three places around the JR Yamashina station.
These four towns are separated into three places around JR Yamashina station.
These four towns are separated into three areas around JR Yamashina station.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 「大塚」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字大塚で、昭和6年、当時の東山区へ編入された際、13町に編成された。
sen.e: The towns which include the name 'Otsuka' on the head are the former Oaza Otsuka, Yamashina Town, which were reorganized into the thirteen towns when it was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Towns that include the name 'Otsuka' were the former Oaza Otsuka, Yamashina Town, that was reorganized into thirteen towns when it was integrated into Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Town that includes the name 'Otsuka' is the former Oaza Otsuka, Yamashinacho Town, that was reorganized into thirteen towns when it was integrated into Higashiyamaku Ward in 1931.

sen.j: 「大宅」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字大宅で、昭和6年、当時の東山区へ編入された際、25町に編成された。
sen.e: The towns which include the name of 'Oyake' on the head are the former Oaza Oyake, Yamashina Town, which were reorganized into the twenty-five towns when it was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Towns that include the name 'Oyake' were the former Oaza Oyake, Yamashina Town, that was reorganized into twenty-five towns when it was integrated into Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Town that includes the name 'Oyake' is the former Oaza Oyake, Yamashinacho Town, that was reorganized into twenty-five towns when it was integrated into Higashiyamaku Ward in 1931.

sen.j: 平成6年（1994年）、区画整理による町界変更が実施され、大宅神納・沢・石郡・細田・関生・早稲ノ内を大宅神納町・沢町・石郡町・細田町・関生町・早稲ノ内町に改称した。
sen.e: In 1994 the borders of town were changed in accordance with the land readjustment project, and the names of Oyake Kanno, Sawa, Ishigori, Hosoda, Sekisho and Wasenouchi were changed into Oyake Kanno-cho, Sawa-cho, Ishigori-cho, Hosoda-cho, Sekisho-cho and Wasenouchi-cho.

In 1994 town borders were changed in accordance with the land readjustment project, and the names of Oyake Kanno, Sawa, Ishigori, Hosoda, Sekisho and Wasenouchi were changed into Oyake Kanno-cho, Sawa-cho, Ishigori-cho, Hosoda-cho, Sekisho-cho and Wasenouchi-cho.

In 1994 town borders were changed in accordance with the land readjustment project, and the names of Oyake Kanno, Sawa, Ishigori, Hosoda, Sekisho and Wasenouchi were changed into Oyake Kanno-cho, Sawa-cho, Ishigori-cho, Hosoda-cho, Sekisho-cho and Wasenouchi-cho, respectively.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞき表記を変えました。

sen.j: 「音羽」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字音羽で、昭和6年、当時の東山区へ編入された際、19町に編成された。

sen.j: 「御陵」を冠称する町名はもとの山科町大字御陵で、昭和6年、当時の東山区へ編入された際、30町に編成された。
sen.e: The towns which include the name of 'Misasagi' on the head are the former Oaza Misasagi, Yamashina Town, which were reorganized into the thirty towns when it was integrated into the Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Towns that include the name of 'Misasagi' were the former Oaza Misasagi, Yamashina Town, that was reorganized into thirty towns when it was integrated into Higashiyama Ward in 1931.
Town that includes the name of 'Misasagi' is the former Oaza Misasagi, Yamashinacho Town, that was reorganized into thirty towns when it was integrated into Higashiyamaku Ward in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 山科区の「御陵」は「みささぎ」と読むが、西京区にある「御陵」は「ごりょう」と読む。
sen.e: The Chinese character '御陵' in the Yamashina Ward is pronounced as 'Misasagi' but the one in the Nishikyo Ward is pronounced as 'Goryo.'
The Chinese character '御陵' in Yamashina Ward is pronounced as 'Misasagi' but the one in Nishikyo Ward is pronounced as 'Goryo.'
御陵' in Yamashinaku Ward is pronounced as 'Misasagi' but the that in Nishikyoku Ward is pronounced as 'Goryo'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
